intro: Sertula brachystachys, commonly known as the short-stalked sertula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sertula brachystachys is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
